dct_description_sm: Alternate title: Ch'ongjin, Korea. In upper left margin: Korea city plans 1:12,500. Polyconic projection. Relief shown by 10 meter contour intervals and spot elevation. Depth shown by fathoms. Korean names transcribed according to the McCune-Reischauer system. Japanese forms of Korean names (in parenthesis) transcribed according to the Modified Hepburn (Romaji) system. With a glossary. "7-46." Relief shown by contours, spot heights, and hachures. Depths shown by soundings. "Contour interval 10 meters ... Depths in fathoms at nearly lowest low water." Three classes of roads or trails, two classes of railroads, and areas of vegetation and cultivation are shown. Some buildings are named. "Korean names are transcribed according to the McCune-Reischauer system ... Japanese forms of Korean names (shown in parentheses) transcribed according to the modified Hepburn (Romaji) system." Military grid. Includes glossary to Japanese, Korean and English terms, inset map "Index to sources," and index to precincts. AMS 1.
dct_publisher_sm: Washington, D.C. : Army Map Service, U.S. Army, 1946.
